horsentpmath

Interface Vector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Vector2, Vector3, Vector4

    public interface Vector
    Has a magnitude and a direction.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector add(Vector vector)
      Adds this Vector to the given vector and returns the result.
      float dot(Vector vector)
      Gets the dot product of this Vector to the given vector.
      float get(int index)
      Gets the component of this Vector at the index.
      int getComponentCount() 
      float[] getComponents() 
      float getMagnitude() 
      Vector normalize() 
      void printVector()
      Prints this Vector to System.out, good for debugging.
      void set(int index, float value)
      Sets the component of this Vector at the index.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        float get(int index)
        Gets the component of this Vector at the index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the component.
        Returns:
        the value of the component at the index.

      • set

        void set(int index,
       float value)
        Sets the component of this Vector at the index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the component.
        value - the new value of the component

      • normalize

        Vector normalize()
        Returns:
        a vector that is the same direction as this Vector, but the magnitude is 1.

      • add

        Vector add(Vector vector)
        Adds this Vector to the given vector and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        vector - the vector to add to this one.
        Returns:
        the resultant vector

      • dot

        float dot(Vector vector)
        Gets the dot product of this Vector to the given vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the vector to dot with this vector
        Returns:
        the dot product of this vector and vector

      • getComponentCount

        int getComponentCount()
        Returns:
        the number of components this Vector has.

      • getComponents

        float[] getComponents()
        Returns:
        the value of this Vector's components.

      • getMagnitude

        float getMagnitude()
        Returns:
        the magnitude of this Vector.

      • printVector

        void printVector()
        Prints this Vector to System.out, good for debugging.
